title: Burning through Identity Transformations will Spark a new Monasticism Movement
description:
I revisit the @Jordan B Peterson @Bret Weinstein conversation about identity. JBP argues that people have a limited capacity for transformations in them. Transformations are tremendously costly for people but vitally important. 

The need for personal transformations is being prompted by the massive transitions we are undergoing as a culture due to technological disruption. This started in the Protestant Reformation where Protestantism replaced the monastic system in much of Europe and in the Americas with a vision for the city replacing the monastery. As Modernity recedes Protestantism goes into crisis. 

The path forward is likely a new monasticism as we're beginning to see in the church, but monasticism will only be part of the answer. 

Jordan Peterson and Bret Weinstein https://youtu.be/2O_gW4VWZ5c
The Kiera Bell Story https://www.persuasion.community/p/keira-bell-my-story
God is Grey Having a Baby https://youtu.be/7DGJBilTS1M
God is Grey How to Lose your Virginity https://youtu.be/XumGnCXyddM
Building a New Christian Sexual Ethic https://mikeinsac.com/2020/01/22/building-a-new-christian-sexual-ethic/
Russell Moore, Church Decline Sexual Ethic https://youtu.be/l5Xoqtg3k8k
Philosophy and Religion in the West https://amzn.to/3ee9gMW
Fatal Discord https://amzn.to/3gf7LAY
https://psmag.com/social-justice/how-tumblr-taught-social-justice-to-a-generation-of-teenagers
Augustine Robin Lane Fox https://amzn.to/2Qt4t2a
Reformations https://amzn.to/2Q4dMpA
Habitus Community https://www.habituscommunity.org/rule-of-life
